revision.text:
== Mediation Case: 2006-05-15 Talk:Calvary Chapel ==
Please observe [[Wikipedia:Etiquette]] and [[WP:TP#Etiquette|Talk Page Etiquette]] in disputes. If you submit complaints or insults your edits are likely to be removed by the mediator, any other [[WP:REFACTOR|refactoring]] of the mediation case by anybody but the mediator is likely to be reverted. If you are not satisfied with the mediation procedure please submit your complaints to [[Wikipedia talk:Mediation Cabal]].
=== Request Information=== : '''Request made by:''' [[User:David L Rattigan|David L Rattigan]] 10:41, 15 May 2006 (UTC) ; ''Where is the issue taking place?'' : [[Talk:Calvary Chapel]] ; ''Who's involved?'' : Myself, anonymous users [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:Contributions&target=66.177.178.5 66.177.178.5] and (recently) [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:Contributions&target=70.89.12.50 70.89.12.50] ; ''What's going on?'' : I tagged the [[Talk:Calvary Chapel]] page with a template for [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Charismatic Christianity]]. It has been removed three times (and replaced by me). I have justified the decision ''with reference to an academic work'', but the other user continues to remove it for purely POV reasons, ie that s/he has made no attempt to justify. ; ''What would you like to change about that? : Very simply, I would like an admin/mediator to step in and make a ruling on it. I don't think it's a tough issue to resolve - it just needs someone with a bit of authority to tell the other person to quit deleting the template, otherwise we'll just be reversing each other's edits till kingdom come. ; ''Would you be willing to be a mediator yourself, and accept a mediation assignment in a different case?'' :Yes, no problem.
:: This is, following the [[Categorical Imperative]], the idea that you might want to do :: what you expect others to do. You don't have to, of course, that's why it's a question.
: ... === Mediator response === Contact made on articles talk page. Seems like a simple disagreement which should be resolved by agreement on sources and consultation of the wikiproject in question. [[User:kcordina|Kcordina]] [[User talk:Kcordina|Talk]] 08:11, 16 May 2006 (UTC) Issue resolved by opening discussion. Closing case [[User:kcordina|Kcordina]] [[User talk:Kcordina|Talk]] 10:27, 18 May 2006 (UTC) === Evidence ===
Please report evidence in this section with {{[[Wikipedia:Mediation_Cabal/Evidence]]}} for misconduct and {{[[Wikipedia:Mediation_Cabal/Evidence3RR]]}} for [[WP:3RR|3RR]] violations. If you need help ask a [[Wikipedia:Mediation_Cabal#Cabalists|mediator]] or an [[WP:AMA|advocate]]. Evidence is of limited use in mediation as the mediator has no authority. Providing some evidence may, however, be useful in making both sides act more civil.
'''[[Wikipedia:Etiquette]]''': ''Although it's understandably difficult in a heated argument, if the other party is not as civil as you'd like them to be, make sure to be more civil than him or her, not less.''
=== Compromise offers ===
This section is for listing and discussing compromise offers.
=== Comments by others === {{Wikipedia:Mediation_Cabal/Comments_Section}} === Discussion === It would be my view that the scope of the Charismatic project is that it does not just encompass the Pentecostal/Charismatic movement "proper", but rather all Christian movements that embrace (in a large or smalll way) the Charismatic gifts, and as such, Calvary Chapel would form part of that [[User:Jaems|Jaems]] 11:54, 17 May 2006 (UTC) :Thanks, [[User:Kcordina|Kcordina]]. Looks like the person who initially stirred up the problem has a history of trying to force a POV on the article anyway, and s/he seems to have disappeared now. Thanks for opening things up. [[User:David L Rattigan|David L Rattigan]] 10:58, 18 May 2006 (UTC) [[Category:Wikipedia Medcab closed cases]]
